name: Cerulion
headline: Open source operating system for robots
description: Cerulion is an open source operating system for robots built by 2 MIT robotics PhDs. Companies like Amazon Robotics and Boston Dynamics AI Institute are using us to develop faster and ship more reliable robots than with ROS. With up to 1000x improvements in communications performance over state of the art, Cerulion is enabling the next generation of embodied AI.

founders.name: Lakshay Sharma, Founder/CEO
founders.description: Lakshay is the cofounder/CEO of robotics middleware startup Cerulion. Prior to this, he studied computer engineering, astrophysics and robotics at the University of Pennsylvania, and researched robot motion planners at MIT.

founders.name: Se Hwan Jeon, Founder
founders.description:
I'm the cofounder of Cerulion along with Lakshay Sharma.
Cerulion is a software interface and abstraction layer to make controlling, debugging, and visualizing commercial robots accessible to everyone. 
Prior to YC, I studied mechanical engineering at the University of Notre Dame and MIT, specializing in robotics, optimal control, and reinforcement learning for legged platforms.

![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/66ada1620cb9e4274b25f26d/66d2118826298d524b3782b1_Black.png)
# Robot middleware that just works
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/66ada1620cb9e4274b25f26d/66b17702ee3caed4d5daf045_hero_image.png)
## Unleash your robots with Cerulion
### Anytime, Anywhere
Cross-platform, easy to use GUI for visualizing, controlling and deploying all your robots reliably
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/66ada1620cb9e4274b25f26d/66b17935b011381238f9363f_Top%20Bar.png)
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/66ada1620cb9e4274b25f26d/66b17a78ee3caed4d5ddb9da_Top%20Bar.png)
## Performance never looked this good
### Bleeding edge communications
Indulge in hyper-fast communications protocols like Zenoh, IceOryx2 and LCM, while enjoying shared memory and zero copy messaging for near real-time performance
Sign up below for early access, and welcome to the future of robotics!

generated_description:
**Cerulion: Pioneering Open Source Robotics**

Founded in 2024 by two PhDs from MIT, Cerulion is on a mission to revolutionize robot operating systems with its open-source platform. In a landscape where companies like Amazon Robotics and Boston Dynamics are striving for greater efficiency, Cerulion is emerging as a formidable competitor, boasting communication performance that’s up to 1000 times better than the industry standard.

Imagine an ecosystem where robots communicate effortlessly and reliably – that’s the promise Cerulion delivers. This middleware solution is designed to be cross-platform, providing an intuitive GUI that makes it easy for developers to visualize, control, and deploy their robots seamlessly. It enables near real-time performance through cutting-edge communication protocols like Zenoh, IceOryx2, and LCM, ensuring that robot applications are faster and more reliable than ever.

Despite being a small team of just two, Cerulion is a part of Y Combinator's Batch S24, indicating strong support and validation from this renowned startup accelerator. Their focus on community and collaboration means that anyone interested can access and contribute to their open-source solution, potentially shaping the future of robotics.

In the fast-paced robotics industry, Cerulion is not just keeping up; it's leading the charge towards more advanced, responsive, and capable robotic systems. To learn more and stay updated, check out their website: [Cerulion](https://www.cerulion.com).

So, if you’re in the robotics game, consider this: Would you rather stick with what’s conventional, or join an open-source movement that’s about to change the way robots interact with the world? The future is bright—and it's open-source.
